geo:siteIdentification.geo:notes: HRAO is located on the Pretoria Series of the Transvaal System. Territory occupied or else underlain by the System embraces the greater part of the Central Transvaal. The Transvaal System is of Precambrian age. The antenna and buildings are situated on Ongeluk Lava (Andesite). Geological info from "NASA Space Geodesy Program:Catalogue of Site Information", Technical Memorandum 4482, March 1993, p196. Interlocking steel rod 36 m deep grouted on the bottom 10 m and isolated in PVC for the next 15 meters. The antenna mount is a self- centering adjustable mount on top of the steel pipe (monument).

geo:siteLocation.geo:notes: Latitude, Longitude and Elevation derived from ITRF96 coordinates at epoch 1997.0, from Z. Altamimi/IGN. HartRAO is situated 60 km NW of Johannesburg. HartRao is a National Research Facility which operates within the foundation for Research Development. Site information from "NASA Space Geodesy Program:Catalogue of Site Information", Technical Memorandum 4482, March 1993, p196.

geo:gnssAntenna.geo:notes: SS6TRI monument. The antenna was believed to have failed on 2009-01-10 and was removed. Later it was discovered the antenna was good, so antenna 4.11 was re-installed on 2009-01-15.
New inline amplifier installed Manufacturer Raven Industries Model Number LA-21-L1L2-N

geo:surveyedLocalTies.geo:notes: ITRF96 coordinates epoch 1997 for HRAO and VLBI points differential components The SLR/VLBI/HRAO/HART/DORIS differential components will be determined in a high precision GPS survey later this year

geo:collocationInformation.geo:notes: The VLBI telescope routinely participates in IRIS, CORE-A and Syowa experiments

geo:humiditySensor.geo:notes: MET unit is 10.6 m below GPS antenna.

geo:pressureSensor.geo:notes: MET unit is 10.6 m below GPS antenna.

geo:temperatureSensor.geo:notes: MET unit is 10.6 m below GPS antenna.

geo:signalObstructions.geo:notes: A 2cm North shift was observed after the antenna was re-installed on 2009-01-15
